5182981.trustfund:
TF026636-PHRD-ST. LUCIA: CARIBBEAN
            HIV/AIDS PREVENTION CONTROL PROJECT,TF058273-PHRD STAFF GRANT PROGRAM - YUKI MURAKAMI,TF030622-IDA CONSULTANTS POOLED CTF - FY05

repnme.cdata!: St. Lucia - HIV/AIDS Prevention and Control Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The HIV/AIDS Prevention and Control
            Project will support the national program, that aims to
            prevent and to control the spread of the epidemic, and to
            mitigate the socio-economic impact of the disease on the
            population. The project will use a two pronged strategy:
            targeting interventions at high risk groups, and
            implementing non-targeted activities for the general
            population. The first component, Community and Civil Society
            Initiatives - will finance HIV/AIDS prevention, care, and
            support activities of Civil Society Organizations (CSOs)
            including, Non-Governmental organizations (NGOs),
            faith-based organizations (FBOs), community-based
            organizations (CBOs), women's organizations,
            professional organizations, trade unions, and private sector
            organizations. The types of HIV/AIDS activities to be
            supported will be demand driven, dependent on the proposals
            presented by the respective CSOs. Activities eligible for
            support include delivery of community based HIV/AIDS
            information, education and communications behavior change
            communication, condom distribution and/or social marketing,
            home based care, community advocacy to reduce HIVIAIDS
            stigma and discrimination, support activities for orphans
            and widows/widowers of HIV/AIDS, as well as support for
            people infected and affected by HIV/AIDS, which includes
            income-generating activities, and, targeted activities for
            HIV/AIDS vulnerable groups. The second component, will
            support the response to HIV/AIDS by non-health sector line
            ministries, namely, basic cross-cutting HIV/AIDS activities
            which all ministries are expected to implement under their
            respective sectoral HIV/AIDS programs. These include:
            development and implementation of workplace HIV/AIDS
            policies, promotion and advocacy to reduce HIV/AIDS stigma,
            and discrimination, and establishment of a support group for
            HIV/AIDS patients and families. The third component will
            strengthen the Ministry of Health capacity in providing
            technical guidance for the national response to HIVIAIDS,
            specifically it will strengthen HIV/AIDS related services
            for prevention, treatment, and care delivered through the
            health care system. Finally, the fourth component will help
            build the institutional capacity for scaling up
            responsiveness, by financing technical advisory services,
            training, staffing, equipment, goods, and general operating
            costs. It includes institutional capacity, surveillance,
            monitoring and evaluation activities, and the establishment
            of a Legal Framework.
